(Source: Bloomberg)

title: This Week in Crypto: Court is in Session (Podcast)
description: Source: Bloomberg, 19:22

title: Oracle Falls After Cloud Sales Miss Optimistic Expectations
description: Oracle Corp. reported quarterly sales in line with analysts’ estimates after its cloud business failed to meet expectations for higher growth. The shares declined in extended trading.

title: Waskita to Cut Borrowings by Two Thirds, Lengthen Debt Maturity
description: Indonesia’s biggest listed construction firm PT Waskita Karya plans to slash its debt load by about two thirds and lengthen the maturities of its borrowings by a decade to preserve its cashflow, according to President Director Destiawan Soewardjono.

title: Thai Tuna Shipper May Exit Red Lobster Chain as Losses Mount
description: Thai Union Group Pcl, one of the world’s biggest makers of canned tuna, is considering an exit from its loss-making Red Lobster unit less than three years after boosting its stake in the US restaurant chain.

title: GoTo to Cut 600 More Jobs as Southeast Asia Tech Firms Retrench
description: Indonesia’s GoTo Group is reducing 600 more jobs, accelerating its cuts in Southeast Asia as growth in the region’s internet markets slows.

title: Renk Gears Up for Germany’s Promised Military Spending Spree
description: Military gearbox maker Renk AG has expanded its workforce and increased production on the expectation that Germany’s pledge to increase defense spending will boost sales in coming years.

title: European Stocks Slump Most in Month With Banks After US Rout
description: European stocks slumped the most in a month on Friday, following a rout in US stocks amid liquidity concerns in the banking sector as investors also braced for payrolls data later today.

title: This Week in China: A $4 Trillion Rebound Is Giving Way to Gloom
description: President Xi Jinping’s efforts to regain the trust of international investors are falling flat, showing the urgency for China to do more to reverse capital outflows.

title: Missile Strikes and a Display of People Power: The Political Week in Photos
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called for the rapid   restoration of power supplies after Russia unleashed another campaign of missile strikes targeting civilian infrastructure, including with weapons against which Ukraine has no defense. The US called the attacks “brutal, unjustified.”

title: ‘Do Nothing’ Bureaucrats Are Imperiling Vietnam’s Economic Boom
description: Vietnam’s Communist Party is growing alarmed about a new mantra taking hold among bureaucrats: Do a lot, get in trouble for a lot. Do less, get in trouble for less. Do nothing, get in trouble for nothing.

title: John Authers: When Above-Trend Earnings Are Not Good News
description: Market perspective is shifting amid a challenging time for retailers, even as Americans are spending more on travel and entertainment. And investors are not flocking to safe havens despite heightened geopolitical tensions.

title: Coinbase CFO Doesn’t Rule Out More Layoffs to Improve Financials
description: Coinbase Global Inc., which laid off staffers twice in the last year, is open to cutting more if it becomes necessary to improve the company’s financial performance, Chief Financial Officer Alesia Haas said.

title: Forget Coinbase. Banks May Win US Custody Race: Bloomberg Crypto
description: In this edition of the Bloomberg Crypto newsletter, Emily Nicolle predicts who the big winners will be from the SEC’s new crypto custody proposals:

title: Investors Watch Japan’s Spring Wage Talks for Clues on BOJ Moves
description: For more than half a century, Japan’s corporate giants have held annual negotiations with labor unions to decide pay increases for the year ahead. Never have those talks meant so much to so many beyond the workers themselves.

title: Hochul’s Budget Plan Could Give MTA Financial Security, CFO Says
description: The funding deficit facing New York’s Metropolitan Transportation Authority could be solved if state lawmakers pass Governor Kathy Hochul’s proposed budget, the agency’s chief financial officer Kevin Willens said.

title: McKinsey to Cut About 2,000 Jobs in One of Its Biggest Headcount Reductions
description: McKinsey & Co. plans to eliminate about 2,000 jobs, one of the consulting giant’s biggest rounds of cuts ever.

title: Walmart's Earnings Caution on US Consumer Economy in 2023
description: The biggest US retailer beat earnings estimates but remains cautious on the path forward for consumers and the economy.

title: Trump, Vornado-Owned San Francisco Buildings Land on Watchlist
description: The properties, which include 555 California St., are facing higher debt payments.

title: Coinbase (COIN) Expected to Post Another Loss as Regulators Circle
description: A deeper look beyond the anticipated fourth-quarter results of Coinbase Global Inc. helps to explain the recent ratcheting up of tensions between Chief Executive Officer Brian Armstrong and US regulators.

title: Euro-Zone Inflation Barely Slows as Core Gauge Hits Record
description: Euro-area inflation slowed by less than anticipated while underlying price pressures surged to a new record, reinforcing expectations that the European Central Bank will have to push borrowing costs ever higher.

title: The Gay Marriage Fight Gets a Lift From Japan’s Biggest Companies
description: In a country with a shrinking population and a tight labor market, support for LGBT rights is one way to appeal to more liberal young job-seekers.

title: Elizabeth Warren Wants Biden’s Next Fed Pick to Counter Powell’s Rate Hikes
description: President Joe Biden’s choice for Federal Reserve vice chair will signal where he stands on combating inflation — and whether he agrees with restive progressives worried that the central bank’s rate increases will lead to job losses and recession.

title: Stock Markets Today: War in Ukraine, Tesla's future, China's warning, Silvergate
description: Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

title: Nigeria’s Election Chaos Will Test Tinubu and Obi Alike
description: To fix the country’s economic mess, the next president and opposition leader must redefine their roles.

title: China Loses More Than 40 Million Workers as Population Ages
description: China’s number of working people has fallen by more than 41 million in the past three years, reflecting both the coronavirus pandemic’s toll on the economy and a decline in the working age population.

title: Asian Equities Swing Lower, Led by China Tech: Markets Wrap
description: A gauge of Asian stocks swung lower as trading got underway in China, led by declines in Hong Kong listed technology shares.

title: UK House Prices Are Already Down 11% in Real Terms
description: And that’s not a bad thing.

title: What’s Happening in the World Economy: Wages May Determine if US Lands Softly
description: Hello. Today we look at one paradox which may help deliver a soft landing in the US economy, signs of a rebound in China’s economy and the outlook for US inflation.

title: White House and Congress Policymakers, Check Your Presumptuousness
description: Don’t dismiss people’s observations. Averages don’t necessarily predict individual experience.

title: Goldman’s CEO Sees Better Chance of Soft Landing for Economy
description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. Chief Executive Officer David Solomon said there’s a “meaningfully higher” chance of a soft landing for the economy now than there was six months ago, echoing the sentiments of his peers that the US could avoid a serious downturn.

title: China's Gift to the World Is a Goldilocks Economy
description: As most of the world’s major central banks fight inflation with rate hikes, China is re-emerging from strict Covid policies and set for a boom. The question is whether the added demand helps or hurts the global economy. And with tensions running high between Beijing and Washington, what does China’s growth target say about their macro policy?

title: Morgan Stanley’s Wilson Sees 20% Downside for Tech, Meme Stocks
description: Morgan Stanley’s Michael Wilson says he still sees some 20% downside on some of the big technology and meme stocks, without specifying which ones.

title: Singapore’s Sea Posts First Profit After E-Commerce Holds Up
description: Sea Ltd. reported its first-ever profit, a milestone in the Southeast Asian gaming and e-commerce giant’s turnaround effort to convince investors of its money-making potential.

title: Core Inflation Shock Spurs Total Risk Revamp for Billion-Dollar Invesco Fund
description: Alessio de Longis spent the last three months loading up on risk in his $1.1 billion Invesco Global Allocation Fund. Now, he’s winding down those positions and reversing course back to safety.

title: Inflation Dooms 60/40 Comeback as Stocks, Bonds Move in Lockstep
description: As the year began, it looked like yields had surged high enough to allow bonds to resume their traditional role as a refuge from stock-market turmoil. It didn’t last long.

title: BOE’s Catherine Mann Says the UK Pound Could Weaken Further
description: Bank of England policy maker Catherine Mann said the pound could weaken further as investors absorb the implication of plans by the US Federal Reserve and European Central Bank to raise interest rates.

title: Stealth Fiscal Stimulus Is Complicating the Federal Reserve's Job
description: State and local governments are flush with cash, which may enable the economy to avoid a recession. The trade-off may be elevated inflation.

title: European Stocks Edge Higher as Investors Await Central Bank Cues
description: European equities gained slightly, reversing earlier declines, as investors mulled robust economic data from the UK and Germany, while weighing the monetary policy outlook before Jerome Powell’s testimony today.

title: Halifax Says UK House Prices Are Rising the Most Since June
description: Halifax said UK house prices rose at the quickest monthly pace since June, suggesting strength in the property market that may prevent a deep decline.

title: US Energy Regains Its Swagger While Rest of World Gets IRA Envy
description: Energy executives and Biden administration officials in Houston had a simple message for Europe and other regions griping that US climate spending will starve them of investment: Stop complaining and put up the cash to enact measures of your own.

title: How Much Do Traders Earn in Australia? Some New Graduates Get $400,000
description: Graduate traders are earning salaries of as much as $400,000 straight out of school.

title: Public More Positive About Immigration Despite Record High Arrivals
description: Public attitudes towards immigration are becoming more positive despite record high levels of arrivals, a think tank has said.

title: Bloomberg Evening Briefing: Hot Jobs Numbers Back Up Powell’s Rate Warning
description: Get caught up.

title: Granholm Extols Oil Industry For Output Boost in Sign of Detente
description: US Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm praised oil executives for boosting output and lauded the industry’s “creative visionaries” in an attempt to ease tensions between the Biden administration and fossil-fuel producers.

title: Poland’s Top Refiner Is Weaning Itself Off of Russian Crude Oil
description: PKN Orlen has all but pivoted away from Russian crude at its refineries in Poland, Lithuania and the Czech Republic a year after its neighbor invaded Ukraine.

title: Hong Kong Property: A Chaotic Rebound as Commercial Real Estate Lags
description: For the city to reclaim its position as Asia’s preeminent financial center it needs to ensure a rebound in commercial real estate.

title: Grain Traders Are Banking On Renewal of Vital Ukraine Crop Deal
description: The crucial grain deal that revived Ukraine’s crop exports and helped bring down global prices is up for renewal again, and the market is betting on another extension.

title: Snow, Coal Reserve, Budget Lookahead, Child Care: The Readout
description: The Met office went full drama mode this morning in its description of the unexpected cold snap that's swept Britain: “A battle between cold Arctic air and milder Atlantic air will result in disruptive snow.” Battle?!

title: Treasury’s No. 2 to Pitch African Countries on Pressuring Russia
description: The US Treasury Department’s second-highest official will take a simple message to a handful of African countries later this month: The sooner Russia ends its war in Ukraine, the better off you are.

title: Apple TV+ Show ‘Extrapolations’ Takes on Climate Crisis: Review
description: A new series from the writer of Contagion dramatizes life in the not-so-distant future on a warming planet.

title: US Not Seeking Technology Decoupling From China, Raimondo Says

title: NPC 2023: Top 3 Takeaways
description: China's annual session of Parliament, the National People's Congress, was one of the more  consequential ones in decades. Xi Jinping was voted unanimously as supreme leader of the world’s No. 2 economy. Stephen Engle gives us the top three takeaways that make this year's session different. Bloomberg's Stephen Engle reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: India G-20: Russia Clears Vladimir Putin’s Schedule for September Summit

title: UK Fears Biden Subsidies May Lure £2 Billion of Climate Cash

title: Karpowership’s Appeal Refused, Deepening South Africa’s Power Crisis
description: Karpowership, the Turkish company seeking to supply 1,220 megawatts of electricity to South Africa, had one of three appeals against adverse environmental rulings rejected, a person with knowledge of the matter said, potentially delaying a solution to the country’s power crisis.

description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.Rishi Sunak ended the week with a deal with France to cut migration via small boats in the English Channel. But almost as soon as he bid Emmanuel Macron adieu, his critics started questioning his political strategy — and the more than   £500 million the UK agreed to pay France to help patrol its borders.

title: America’s Anti-China Restrictions Are Going Local: New Economy Saturday
description: While US-China trade remains robust, political forces across America attempting to restrict economic relations are spreading, with a wave of local initiatives from Virginia to Texas.

title: Highland Gold Owner Weighs Buying Polymetal Assets: Kommersant
description: Mining magnate Vladislav Sviblov is weighing a purchase of some of the Russian assets of Polymetal International Plc, Kommersant newspaper reported, citing people familiar with the situation it didn’t name.

title: Crypto Shaken as SVB Exposure Depegs $37 Billion Stablecoin

title: 'Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe' Full Show (03/10/2023)
description: "Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe" live from London, tracking the breaking and top business news stories in the lead-up to the opening of European markets. title: Oracle Falls After Cloud Sales Miss Optimistic Expectations
description: Oracle Corp. reported quarterly sales in line with analysts’ estimates after its cloud business failed to meet expectations for higher growth. The shares declined in extended trading.

title: Waskita to Cut Borrowings by Two Thirds, Lengthen Debt Maturity
description: Indonesia’s biggest listed construction firm PT Waskita Karya plans to slash its debt load by about two thirds and lengthen the maturities of its borrowings by a decade to preserve its cashflow, according to President Director Destiawan Soewardjono.

title: Thai Tuna Shipper May Exit Red Lobster Chain as Losses Mount
description: Thai Union Group Pcl, one of the world’s biggest makers of canned tuna, is considering an exit from its loss-making Red Lobster unit less than three years after boosting its stake in the US restaurant chain.

title: GoTo to Cut 600 More Jobs as Southeast Asia Tech Firms Retrench
description: Indonesia’s GoTo Group is reducing 600 more jobs, accelerating its cuts in Southeast Asia as growth in the region’s internet markets slows.

title: Renk Gears Up for Germany’s Promised Military Spending Spree
description: Military gearbox maker Renk AG has expanded its workforce and increased production on the expectation that Germany’s pledge to increase defense spending will boost sales in coming years.

title: European Stocks Slump Most in Month With Banks After US Rout
description: European stocks slumped the most in a month on Friday, following a rout in US stocks amid liquidity concerns in the banking sector as investors also braced for payrolls data later today.

title: This Week in China: A $4 Trillion Rebound Is Giving Way to Gloom
description: President Xi Jinping’s efforts to regain the trust of international investors are falling flat, showing the urgency for China to do more to reverse capital outflows.

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called for the rapid   restoration of power supplies after Russia unleashed another campaign of missile strikes targeting civilian infrastructure, including with weapons against which Ukraine has no defense. The US called the attacks “brutal, unjustified.”

title: ‘Do Nothing’ Bureaucrats Are Imperiling Vietnam’s Economic Boom
description: Vietnam’s Communist Party is growing alarmed about a new mantra taking hold among bureaucrats: Do a lot, get in trouble for a lot. Do less, get in trouble for less. Do nothing, get in trouble for nothing.

description: Market perspective is shifting amid a challenging time for retailers, even as Americans are spending more on travel and entertainment. And investors are not flocking to safe havens despite heightened geopolitical tensions.

description: For more than half a century, Japan’s corporate giants have held annual negotiations with labor unions to decide pay increases for the year ahead. Never have those talks meant so much to so many beyond the workers themselves.

title: Hochul’s Budget Plan Could Give MTA Financial Security, CFO Says
description: The funding deficit facing New York’s Metropolitan Transportation Authority could be solved if state lawmakers pass Governor Kathy Hochul’s proposed budget, the agency’s chief financial officer Kevin Willens said.

description: McKinsey & Co. plans to eliminate about 2,000 jobs, one of the consulting giant’s biggest rounds of cuts ever.

The question is whether the added demand helps or hurts the global economy. And with tensions running high between Beijing and Washington, what does China’s growth target say about their macro policy?

title: Sunak Backers Look for Signs of Unionist View on Brexit Deal
description: The UK government is watching to see whether skeptical members of Northern Ireland’s Democratic Unionist Party back his new deal with the European Union, as Prime Minister Rishi Sunak embarked on a push to win support for the agreement.

title: SPACs Go From Boom Time to Bankruptcy and Fire Sales
description: Hi, it’s Bailey Lipschultz in New York with a look at the still-crumbling SPAC industry. Elsewhere, Toshiba’s $15 billion deal is stalled and billionaire Lasry to sell Bucks stake.      Today's top stories

title: Microsoft Building Contractors Fired For Protesting Wage Theft, Complaint Claims
description: Dozens of construction staff working on a Microsoft Corp. data center were illegally fired for protesting, a union alleged in a US labor board complaint.

title: DeSantis Book Sets Up White House Bid Without Hitting Trump
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis’s memoir, “The Courage to Be Free,” illustrates his success transforming the Republican Party’s vision, from limiting government’s reach in American lives to expanding it so broadly that even school boards become political battlegrounds.

title: Richest Atlanta District’s Move to Secede Clears a Senate Panel
description: A move to create a new city out of the wealthiest and whitest areas in Atlanta got a little more traction this week, after being blocked by Georgia legislative leaders last year.

title: CityLab Daily: Can NYC’s Dollar Vans Go Green, and Go Legit?
description: Also today: Kansas City’s $1.5 billion airport renovations spurs hopes for business boom, and crime defines Chicago’s mayoral race.

title: Canaccord Deal Battle Pits Ex-CIBC Bankers Against Each Other
description: Two executives spearheading a leveraged buyout of Canaccord Genuity Group Inc. have a problem: They can’t get the deal past a board member who had previously been a close colleague at one of Canada’s biggest banks.

title: ‘Do Nothing’ Bureaucrats Are Imperiling Vietnam’s Economic Boom
description: Vietnam’s Communist Party is growing alarmed about a new mantra taking hold among bureaucrats: Do a lot, get in trouble for a lot. Do less, get in trouble for less. Do nothing, get in trouble for nothing.

title: John Authers: When Above-Trend Earnings Are Not Good News
description: Market perspective is shifting amid a challenging time for retailers, even as Americans are spending more on travel and entertainment. And investors are not flocking to safe havens despite heightened geopolitical tensions.

title: Coinbase CFO Doesn’t Rule Out More Layoffs to Improve Financials
description: Coinbase Global Inc., which laid off staffers twice in the last year, is open to cutting more if it becomes necessary to improve the company’s financial performance, Chief Financial Officer Alesia Haas said.

title: Forget Coinbase. Banks May Win US Custody Race: Bloomberg Crypto
description: In this edition of the Bloomberg Crypto newsletter, Emily Nicolle predicts who the big winners will be from the SEC’s new crypto custody proposals:

title: Investors Watch Japan’s Spring Wage Talks for Clues on BOJ Moves
description: For more than half a century, Japan’s corporate giants have held annual negotiations with labor unions to decide pay increases for the year ahead. Never have those talks meant so much to so many beyond the workers themselves.

title: Hochul’s Budget Plan Could Give MTA Financial Security, CFO Says
description: The funding deficit facing New York’s Metropolitan Transportation Authority could be solved if state lawmakers pass Governor Kathy Hochul’s proposed budget, the agency’s chief financial officer Kevin Willens said.

title: McKinsey to Cut About 2,000 Jobs in One of Its Biggest Headcount Reductions
description: McKinsey & Co. plans to eliminate about 2,000 jobs, one of the consulting giant’s biggest rounds of cuts ever.

title: Walmart's Earnings Caution on US Consumer Economy in 2023
description: The biggest US retailer beat earnings estimates but remains cautious on the path forward for consumers and the economy.

title: Trump, Vornado-Owned San Francisco Buildings Land on Watchlist
description: The properties, which include 555 California St., are facing higher debt payments.

title: Coinbase (COIN) Expected to Post Another Loss as Regulators Circle
description: A deeper look beyond the anticipated fourth-quarter results of Coinbase Global Inc. helps to explain the recent ratcheting up of tensions between Chief Executive Officer Brian Armstrong and US regulators.

title: Netanyahu Inherits Economy Resilient to Years of Turmoil
description: Israel has weathered recent global economic storms better than most and nearly four years of government instability at home thanks to deep structural changes in its $482 billion economy.

title: Republican-Led Congress Would Need More Ideas Than Just Tax Cuts
description: A GOP-controlled Congress would be more likely to force a government shutdown than attempt to solve the nation’s problems.

title: Taming Inflation Is Only Half the Fed’s Battle
description: The same industries that are slowing now could snap back abruptly if the central bank eases up too soon, triggering a whole new round of overheating and tightening.

title: South Africa Needs to Expand 5% Consistently to Cut Unemployment
description: South Africa’s economy needs to expand consistently at 5% for years to create jobs and lower an unemployment rate that’s among the world’s highest, according to central bank Deputy Governor Rashad Cassim.

title: Five Things You Need to Know: Fed Hike, Credit Suisse, UK inflation, Denmark
description: Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

title: Don't Fear the UK's Coming Zombie Apocalypse
description: Legions of undead British companies due to finally fall as interest rates rise should give way to a healthier economy.

title: Stocks Stage Cautious Rally Ahead of Fed Meeting: Markets Wrap
description: Equities edged higher ahead of the Federal Reserve’s policy meeting Wednesday after a cautious open in Asia as Chinese stocks continued to climb from lows struck at the beginning of the week.

title: New Zealand Jobless Rate Stays Near Record Low, Wages Soar
NYC Salary Law: Pay Transparency in Job Listings Off to a Rocky Start
description: Employers struggle to adapt to the city’s new regulations after months of notice

title: RBNZ Says Economy Will Slow as Rising Rates Curb Consumption
Hot Emerging-Market Debt Trade Is a Warning Sign, Mackenzie Says
description: Buying emerging-market debt is becoming a “consensus trade” in what could be an early warning sign for the sector, according to Konstantin Boehmer, co-head of fixed income at Toronto-based Mackenzie Investments Corp.

title: Something Has Shifted in How People Are Talking About the Economy
description: A glimmer of light!

title: UK Recession May be Cut Short by High-Spending Chinese Tourists
description: The reopening of China’s borders is set to allow the return of its high-spending tourists back to the UK, helping to reduce the size of its recession in 2023.

title: What's Happening in the World Economy: India Could Drive Global Growth
description: Hello. Today we look at optimism toward India as the world’s next big growth driver, the week ahead for the global economy, and research suggesting inflation can be contained without a spike in unemployment.

title: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day
description: Citadel booked a record $16 billion in profit for clients last year, Spotify becomes the latest tech giant to be linked with job cuts and the ECB increasingly looks like a hawkish outlier.  —  David Goodman

title: A Polarized US Hurtles Toward a Fiscal Cliff
description: The risk has never been higher that the world’s largest economy could default on its national debt for the first time.

title: Don’t Get Disoriented by Recession-Talk Fatigue
description: After a year of relentless negativity, investors are pining for a more upbeat narrative. The economy may not cooperate.

title: Germany ‘More or Less’ Stagnated in Late 2022, Bundesbank Says
description: Germany’s economy performed better than expected in the fourth quarter and “more or less” stagnated, according to the Bundesbank, confirming an earlier estimate that fed optimism over the euro zone dodging a winter recession.

title: Trivedi: Slow US Growth
description: Kamakshya Trivedi, Head of Global Foreign Exchange, Interest Rates & Emerging Markets Strategy Research,  Goldman Sachs gives his outlook on FX, emerging markets and recession concerns.  He speaks with Yousef Gamal El-Din on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Middle East." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Morgan Stanley’s Wilson Says US Stocks Aren’t Pricing Weak Data
description: The improving sentiment toward US equities is at odds with a backdrop of weakening economic data and earnings, according to Morgan Stanley strategist Michael Wilson.

title: The Most Expensive Neighborhoods in the US, From Florida to New York
description: Real estate values in wealthy neighborhoods are reflecting broader pandemic migration.

title: BofA’s Moynihan Says Consumers Remain Resilient Amid Inflation
description: US consumers are still in a position of strength despite persistent inflation and other economic headwinds, Bank of America Corp. Chief Executive Officer Brian Moynihan said.

title: At North Sea Field a Scoreboard Tracks Norway’s Rising Oil Clout
description: Amid a wall of screens in the control room of Equinor ASA’s Johan Sverdrup oil field in the North Sea ticks a tally of the day’s production — and a measure of Norway’s growing importance to Europe’s energy security.

title: IMF Chief Says Global Fight Against Hot Inflation Showing Gains
description: The International Monetary Fund sees growing evidence that a global inflation spike that’s triggered a cost-of-living crisis in many countries is subsiding, Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said.

title: ChatGPT Bias Is Latest Conservative Attack on Big Tech
description: Radio hosts and members of Congress claim to see signs of liberal bias built into the responses the AI program generates.

title: Camilla to Avoid Controversial Diamond by Reusing Crown at Coronation
description: The controversial Koh-i-noor diamond will not feature in the coronation of the Queen Consort, with Camilla opting to reuse the crown it was once set in instead.

title: Campaign 2024: Why Republicans and Democrats Disagree About Schools
description: Democrats see education as primarily an economic issue, while Republicans view it through a cultural lens.

title: Solid UK Jobs Data Might Mean More Rate Hikes
description: The UK jobs market remains strong. That makes a Bank of England rate peak of 4% less likely.

title: Qatar donates World Cup mobile homes to earthquake survivors
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Qatar plans to send 10,000 cabins and caravans from last year's World Cup to provide shelter for survivors of the Turkish earthquakes, officials said.

title: Russia’s Grip on Nuclear-Power Trade Is Only Getting Stronger
description: New data show exports in the strategic industry jumped more than 20% last year, as long-term projects boost Russian influence.

title: Kevin McCarthy’s Leadership Strategy in the House Isn't Working
description: The House speaker eventually will have to vote to raise the debt limit, no matter what the GOP’s extremist flank wants.

title: OPEC Oil Output Rose as Nigeria Extended Recovery Before Elections
description: OPEC’s oil production increased last month as Nigeria extended its recovery ahead of presidential elections.

title: The Cardi B, McDonald's Mismatch Isn’t About Family Values
description: The backlash over her endorsement deal with McDonald’s misunderstands the place the singer holds among her fans, many of whom are young parents.

title: Supply Chain Latest: Shipping Rate Drop Muddles Cargo Talks at TPM23
description: New vessel orders combined with plummeting cargo volumes have extended a drop-off in shipping rates — just as ocean carriers and importers met this week to hammer out details of upcoming contracts.

title: What's Happening in the World Economy: The Fed's Political Challenges
description: Hello. Today we look at the political challenges flooding the Federal Reserve, why many senior-level women are bowing out of the workforce, and a cautionary note about Chinese household deleveraging.

title: The Environmental Disaster Lurking Inside Your Chocolate Bar
description: As the cocoa industry boasts increased sustainability, low farmer pay may be accelerating rainforest destruction.

title: Citigroup Expands Climate Goals to Include Automakers and Coal
description: Citigroup Inc. is expanding its climate goals with a plan to reduce its financing to heavy-polluting industries, including automakers and thermal coal-mining companies.

title: Pakistan Raises Key Rate 300 Basis Points as IMF Loan Hangs
description: Pakistan’s central bank raised its benchmark interest rate to 20% to rein in the fastest inflation since the 1960’s and as the government seeks to resume a $6.5 billion bailout from the International Monetary Fund.

title: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day
description: Elon Musk’s Tesla plan falls flat, Credit Suisse lures clients with higher deposit rates and the crypto fallout ensnares a US bank. —  Kristine Aquino

title: Chips Act Is Disrupting the Venture Capital World
description: Biden is tying startup funding to his national and social policy priorities. That’s probably an improvement over Silicon Valley values.

title: Earthquakes, Bumper Profits, Oil and Gas: The Readout
description: At the time of writing, the death toll in Turkey and Syria from the devastating earthquakes has surpassed 20,000. Earlier this week, the UK announced it would send £8 million worth of equipment to the area, as well as 77 search and rescue specialists to help locate survivors — one among many countries to offer support.

title: Pollution From Life-Saving Drugs May Add to Superbug Crisis, UN Says
description: A new UN report makes recommendations for reducing pollutants that are making bacterial infections harder to treat.

title: EV Battery Firm of Tesla Co-Founder Wins $2 Billion Government Loan
description: Redwood Materials plans to build enough components to make 1 million EV batteries a year with the loan from a US Department of Energy program.

title: Fed-Funds Call at 8% Vaults One Strategist Past the Pack at 6%
description: Traders wagering this week on the Federal Reserve lifting its benchmark interest rate to 6% are still aiming way too low, according to Dominique Dwor-Frecaut.

title: Chicago’s Population Shift Puts Latinos at Heart of Mayoral Race
BOE Warns UK Public Sector Pay Raises May Spur Inflation
description: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey warned that big increases in public sector pay would add to inflation unless they were offset by tax increases.

title: High California Gas Prices Show Challenges of Renewable Energy
description: A jump in demand for natural gas, supply constraints and aging infrastructure have left the region vulnerable to price spikes

title: Deliveroo Plans to Cut 9% of Staff to Focus on Profit
description: Deliveroo Plc said it plans to cut 350 jobs, or about 9% of its workforce, as the company focuses on profits and a way to deal with a “difficult consumer environment.”

title: Cholera Outbreak Is Spreading Exponentially in Africa, WHO Warns
description: Africa is facing an exponential rise in cholera cases, with infections in the single month of January already at a third of the level reached in the whole of 2022, according to the World Health Organization.

title: China Spy Balloon Shouldn't Stop Biden From Sending Blinken to Beijing
description: Resuming diplomacy isn’t a sign of weakness. It’s critical to ensure future spats between the US and China don’t escalate dangerously.

title: Thai Mall Builder Central Pattana Scouts for Acquisitions, Plans Mega Projects
description: Central Pattana Pcl is open to acquiring assets that fits well with its strategy of housing retail, residential and office spaces at a single location as the mall developer pushes ahead with a 135 billion baht ($3.9 billion) expansion.

title: China’s Burst of Copper Exports Shows Economy Still Struggling
description: China’s copper smelters are preparing to boost exports, a sign its manufacturing and construction sectors aren’t yet making a decisive recovery from the ravages of the past year.

title: Billionaire Ken Griffin Slammed in Testy Chicago Mayoral Debate
description: One of the hottest topics in the Chicago mayoral election is a person who doesn’t even live in the city anymore.

title: "Bloomberg Markets: The Close" (03/08/2023)
description: Romaine Bostick & Scarlet Fu bring you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street and tackles Powell's comments, Silvergate's slump and the RBC Conference Guests Today: Fmr. Fed Vice Chair Alan Blinder, Gargi Chaudhari of BlackRock, Economic Policy consultant Kathryn Edwards, Matt Hougan of Bitwise Asset Management, Kristin Ceva of Payden and Regal, Karen Snow of Nasdaq, Diane Jaffee of TCW, Larry Grafstein of RBC Capital Markets, Mark Manson of Citigroup (Source: Bloomberg)

title: 'Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia' Full Show (03/09/2023)
description: Haidi Stroud-Watts in Sydney and Shery Ahn in New York drive to the Asia, Australia and New Zealand market opens while wrapping the biggest stories of the previous day on Wall Street. Today's guests: BMO Family Office CIO Carol Schleif, University of Maryland, College Park Neil Moskowitz Professor of Economics Şebnem Kalemli-Ozcan (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mark Gurman on Apple (Audio)
description: Source: Bloomberg, 3:48

title: South Korean Leader Gets Much-Needed Boost With New Party Boss
description: South Korea’s ruling party elected as its new leader a candidate backed by President Yoon Suk Yeol, who is trying implement a historic deal to mend ties with Japan and win concessions from the US over export curbs that could hurt his country’s chipmakers.

title: Seven & I Rises On Report It’ll Close Unprofitable Japan Stores
description: Seven & I Holdings Co. rose the most in almost two months, extending a record high after a local report said the retailer is considering selling or closing “many” of its Ito-Yokado stores in Japan.

title: Deepening Bond Yield Inversion Suggests Hard Landing
description: The bond market is doubling down on the prospect of a US recession after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell warned of a return to bigger interest-rate hikes. Garfield Reynolds reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Adani Tells Investors All Share-Backed Loans Have Been Paid Back
description: Senior executives of Adani Group told investors in London that billionaire founder Gautam Adani and his family have prepaid all borrowings backed by the Indian conglomerate's company shares, according to people who attended the meeting. Emma O'Brien reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Goldman ‘Albatross’ Weighs on Stock as Solomon Pitch Fizzles
description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. set out to reset the narrative and breathe new life into its stock. Investors aren’t buying it just yet.

title: China's Xi Needs to Radically Restructure State-Owned Companies
description: Pie-in-the-sky promises won’t convince investors. China’s leader needs to take a knife at long last to inefficient state-owned companies.

title: Target Is Investing $5 Billion to Reboot Its Stores
description: The retailer is leaning into its superpower — injecting as much as $5 billion to open new stores, revamp old formats and spark the impulse buy.

title: Sunak Backers Look for Signs of Unionist View on Brexit Deal
description: The UK government is watching to see whether skeptical members of Northern Ireland’s Democratic Unionist Party back his new deal with the European Union, as Prime Minister Rishi Sunak embarked on a push to win support for the agreement.

title: Cholera Outbreak Is Spreading Exponentially in Africa, WHO Warns
description: Africa is facing an exponential rise in cholera cases, with infections in the single month of January already at a third of the level reached in the whole of 2022, according to the World Health Organization.

title: China Spy Balloon Shouldn't Stop Biden From Sending Blinken to Beijing
description: Resuming diplomacy isn’t a sign of weakness. It’s critical to ensure future spats between the US and China don’t escalate dangerously.

title: Thai Mall Builder Central Pattana Scouts for Acquisitions, Plans Mega Projects
description: Central Pattana Pcl is open to acquiring assets that fits well with its strategy of housing retail, residential and office spaces at a single location as the mall developer pushes ahead with a 135 billion baht ($3.9 billion) expansion.

title: China’s Burst of Copper Exports Shows Economy Still Struggling
description: China’s copper smelters are preparing to boost exports, a sign its manufacturing and construction sectors aren’t yet making a decisive recovery from the ravages of the past year.

title: Billionaire Ken Griffin Slammed in Testy Chicago Mayoral Debate
description: One of the hottest topics in the Chicago mayoral election is a person who doesn’t even live in the city anymore.

title: "Bloomberg Markets: The Close" (03/08/2023)
description: Romaine Bostick & Scarlet Fu bring you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street and tackles Powell's comments, Silvergate's slump and the RBC Conference Guests Today: Fmr. Fed Vice Chair Alan Blinder, Gargi Chaudhari of BlackRock, Economic Policy consultant Kathryn Edwards, Matt Hougan of Bitwise Asset Management, Kristin Ceva of Payden and Regal, Karen Snow of Nasdaq, Diane Jaffee of TCW, Larry Grafstein of RBC Capital Markets, Mark Manson of Citigroup (Source: Bloomberg)

title: 'Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia' Full Show (03/09/2023)
description: Haidi Stroud-Watts in Sydney and Shery Ahn in New York drive to the Asia, Australia and New Zealand market opens while wrapping the biggest stories of the previous day on Wall Street. Today's guests: BMO Family Office CIO Carol Schleif, University of Maryland, College Park Neil Moskowitz Professor of Economics Şebnem Kalemli-Ozcan (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mark Gurman on Apple (Audio)
description: Source: Bloomberg, 3:48

title: South Korean Leader Gets Much-Needed Boost With New Party Boss
description: South Korea’s ruling party elected as its new leader a candidate backed by President Yoon Suk Yeol, who is trying implement a historic deal to mend ties with Japan and win concessions from the US over export curbs that could hurt his country’s chipmakers.

title: Seven & I Rises On Report It’ll Close Unprofitable Japan Stores
description: Seven & I Holdings Co. rose the most in almost two months, extending a record high after a local report said the retailer is considering selling or closing “many” of its Ito-Yokado stores in Japan.

title: Deepening Bond Yield Inversion Suggests Hard Landing
description: The bond market is doubling down on the prospect of a US recession after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell warned of a return to bigger interest-rate hikes. Garfield Reynolds reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Adani Tells Investors All Share-Backed Loans Have Been Paid Back
description: Senior executives of Adani Group told investors in London that billionaire founder Gautam Adani and his family have prepaid all borrowings backed by the Indian conglomerate's company shares, according to people who attended the meeting. Emma O'Brien reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Goldman ‘Albatross’ Weighs on Stock as Solomon Pitch Fizzles
description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. set out to reset the narrative and breathe new life into its stock. Investors aren’t buying it just yet.

title: China's Xi Needs to Radically Restructure State-Owned Companies
description: Pie-in-the-sky promises won’t convince investors. China’s leader needs to take a knife at long last to inefficient state-owned companies.

title: Target Is Investing $5 Billion to Reboot Its Stores
description: The retailer is leaning into its superpower — injecting as much as $5 billion to open new stores, revamp old formats and spark the impulse buy.

title: Sunak Backers Look for Signs of Unionist View on Brexit Deal
description: The UK government is watching to see whether skeptical members of Northern Ireland’s Democratic Unionist Party back his new deal with the European Union, as Prime Minister Rishi Sunak embarked on a push to win support for the agreement.

title: SPACs Go From Boom Time to Bankruptcy and Fire Sales
description: Hi, it’s Bailey Lipschultz in New York with a look at the still-crumbling SPAC industry. Elsewhere, Toshiba’s $15 billion deal is stalled and billionaire Lasry to sell Bucks stake.      Today's top stories

title: Microsoft Building Contractors Fired For Protesting Wage Theft, Complaint Claims
description: Dozens of construction staff working on a Microsoft Corp. data center were illegally fired for protesting, a union alleged in a US labor board complaint.

title: DeSantis Book Sets Up White House Bid Without Hitting Trump
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis’s memoir, “The Courage to Be Free,” illustrates his success transforming the Republican Party’s vision, from limiting government’s reach in American lives to expanding it so broadly that even school boards become political battlegrounds.

title: Richest Atlanta District’s Move to Secede Clears a Senate Panel
description: A move to create a new city out of the wealthiest and whitest areas in Atlanta got a little more traction this week, after being blocked by Georgia legislative leaders last year.

title: CityLab Daily: Can NYC’s Dollar Vans Go Green, and Go Legit?
description: Also today: Kansas City’s $1.5 billion airport renovations spurs hopes for business boom, and crime defines Chicago’s mayoral race.

title: Canaccord Deal Battle Pits Ex-CIBC Bankers Against Each Other
description: Two executives spearheading a leveraged buyout of Canaccord Genuity Group Inc. have a problem: They can’t get the deal past a board member who had previously been a close colleague at one of Canada’s biggest banks.

title: Week's Best Reads: Sydney's Rookie Traders, India's Gay Marriage Decision
description: In the ongoing fight for equality, the women of Iran are standing up against the Islamic country’s chafing dress code, while the work of a few brave souls could extend same-sex marriage rights to more than a billion people. China is pushing to end an antiquated wedding tradition in hopes of reversing a population decline, as Hong Kong debates whether Covid camps could help its housing crisis.

title: Bank Rout: It's a Curveball for Markets Anxious About the Outlook
description: Signs of banking distress are jolting bonds and adding to the litany of worries for investors figuring out where the US economy is at.

title: UK Worker Shortage: How to Soften the Blow of Premature Retirement
description: Many Brits are being forced out of work due to ill health. Here’s advice for making less money last longer.

title: Treasuries Surge as Bond Bulls Seize on Bank Fears, Jobless Data
description: Investors sought the safety of bonds for a second day as jitters over a rout in bank stocks hit risk sentiment and traders speculated that rate-hike bets had gone too far too fast.

title: GM Offers Buyouts to Accelerate $2 Billion Cost Cutting Plan
description: General Motors Co. said it’s offering voluntary buyouts to the majority of salaried staff as part of a plan announced in January to cut $2 billion in annual costs.

title: US Planned Layoffs Jump to Mark Worst Start to a Year Since 2009
description: Layoffs announced by US employers quintupled in February from a year earlier and were the largest at the start of any year since 2009, led by technology companies.

title: Why ‘MasterChef’ Contestant Nick DiGiovanni Said No to Harvard Business School
description: Harvard grad Nick DiGiovanni decided that he didn’t need an MBA.

title: US Jobless Claims Jump to 211,000, Led by New York, California
description: Applications for US unemployment benefits last week rose to the highest since December, driven by spikes in California and New York and suggesting some softening in what’s still a tight labor market.

title: ADIA Said to Near Buying $500 Million Stake in India’s Lenskart
description: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority is nearing a deal to acquire a stake in Indian eyewear startup Lenskart Solutions Pvt. for about $500 million, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: How Much Do Traders Earn in Australia? Some New Graduates Get $400,000
description: Graduate traders are earning salaries of as much as $400,000 straight out of school.

title: Norway’s Statistics Office Sees Growth Returning to Normal Pace

description: Asian stocks slumped, with financials leading a region-wide selloff, as investors fretted over the risks to broader markets from troubles emanating at a Silicon Valley-based lender. Continued losses in Chinese equities added to the weakness.

description: Signs of banking distress are jolting bonds and adding to the litany of worries for investors figuring out where the US economy is at.

description: As Britain battles rip-roaring inflation, fueled by a shortage of staff, one cohort of workers is notably missing in action from the labor force.

description: Singapore boosted its gold reserves by about 30% in January, joining central banks from China to Turkey in building up holdings of the precious metal.

description: US banks are being forced to do something they haven’t done for 15 years: fight for deposits.

description: After imposing three years of sacrifice, Xi Jinping’s government let Covid tear through the population in two months. Moving on won’t be easy.

title: Apple’s (AAPL) Stock Gets Its Mojo Back, Leading Mega-Cap Peers
description: After a shaky start to the year, Apple Inc.’s stock has once again reclaimed the mantle of the go-to investment in Big Tech, even winning support from Goldman Sachs Group Inc. after years in which the brokerage refrained from recommending the shares.

title: Is an RV Downturn the Same Recession Signal as Before?
description: The industry, an economic bellwether in the past, is experiencing sharp sales declines. But after an epic pandemic buying boom, that may have been inevitable.

title: Xi Reigns Supreme in China After His Reelection as President
description: For five years, much of Chinese politics has turned on Xi Jinping’s unrelenting quest for a third term. Now he’s got to own it.

title: BofA’s Hartnett Sees Stocks Stuck on Fed Until Recession Evident
description: US stocks hanging on Federal Reserve policy signals are boxed in a “neurotic” trading range that will only break once economic data unambiguously point to a recession, Bank of America Corp. strategists say.

title: Thai Tuna Shipper May Exit Red Lobster Chain as Losses Mount
description: Thai Union Group Pcl, one of the world’s biggest makers of canned tuna, is considering an exit from its loss-making Red Lobster unit less than three years after boosting its stake in the US restaurant chain.

title: GoTo to Cut 600 More Jobs as Southeast Asia Tech Firms Retrench
description: Indonesia’s GoTo Group is reducing 600 more jobs, accelerating its cuts in Southeast Asia as growth in the region’s internet markets slows.

title: Biden Should Be Wary of Saudi Crown Prince MBS's Overture on Abraham Accords
description: The White House should pause to consider what’s behind this 180-degree turn — and why it’s coming now.

description: “Lodestones” started out as lightning-infused magical rocks that could cure baldness. Now they’re an essential part of our machine-driven world.

title: India G-20: Russia Clears Vladimir Putin’s Schedule for September Summit
description: The Kremlin is opening up Vladimir Putin’s schedule around this year’s G-20 summit in India in September to make it possible for the Russian president to participate in the leaders’ gathering after skipping the last two, according to people familiar with the planning.

title: Glossary of AI Terms: Meaning of GPT, OpenAI, Machine Learning, Chatbots
description: The arrival in late 2022 of the ChatGPT chatbot, with its remarkably sophisticated — if occasionally erroneous — answers to a vast array of queries, was a milestone in artificial intelligence that’s taken decades to reach. Scientists were experimenting with “computer vision” and giving machines the ability to “read” as far back as the 1960s. Chatbots began life when the Beatles were still making music. Today it’s possible to imagine a computer being able to perform most human tasks better than p

title: Global Economy Latest: Resilience and Monetary Tightening
description: Hello. Today we look at how the global economy is still playing catch-up after the pandemic, BOJ Governor Kuroda’s mixed legacy and research suggesting elevated inflation may be around for a while yet.

title: Latvia Begins Shipping Cars Seized From Drunk Drivers to Ukraine
description: Cars seized by Latvian authorities as part of drunk-driving violations are being shipped to Ukraine in an act of solidarity with the war-battered country.

title: US Envoy Calls on Hungary’s Orban to Pivot from Russia ‘Now’
description: The US ambassador to Hungary said Prime Minister Viktor Orban has reached a crossroads and that the “time is now” for him to pivot away from Russia and shore up the country’s relations with its western allies.

title: Made in China Remains Reality for US Clothing Companies
description: Brands are finding few factories outside the country that can produce the quality and quantity they require.

title: Erdogan Warns Turkish Voters of ‘Disaster’ If Opposition Wins
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan warned voters that victory in May elections for the broadest-ever opposition alliance of his 20-year rule would be a catastrophe for the country.

title: Your Saturday Briefing: A Bank Failure Foretold; 2024 Already?
description: Something for the weekend

title: Rishi Sunak’s Small Boats Strategy in English Channel Is a Gamble
description: The British prime minister has made stopping small boats crossing the English Channel one of his five priorities. But members of his own party worry he’ll fail.

title: Xi Cements Hold, Biggest US Bank Failure since 2008 with SVB: Weekend Reads
description: President Xi Jinping completed his shake-up of China’s top personnel this week, with the legislature voting to install a key ally and former aide as premier.

title: Biden's Budget Tax Plan Is Tough for Two-Career Couples
description: The US tax code often penalizes high-earning spouses who earn similar amounts. Biden’s budget could make it even worse.

title: A Surge of Biolabs, Washington’s Economic Gamble: A Week of Big Take
Biden Budget Reflects Old Battle Lines Between Democrats and GOP
description: Republicans continue to fight for smaller government, and Democrats for a more active government, even though their voters don’t necessarily share those goals.

title: Ivy League Athletic Scholarship Lawsuit Exposes Cartel-Like Behavior
description: Plaintiffs say the universities have engaged in price-fixing by agreeing not to offer athletic scholarships. It’s a fair point.

title: Mortgage Rates Aren't Going Anywhere Soon, Homebuyers
description: Homebuyers need to consider that they’ll be living with their interest rate for a lot longer than they hope.

title: Rishi Sunak Paris Success May Not Last: Your Saturday UK Briefing
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.Rishi Sunak ended the week with a deal with France to cut migration via small boats in the English Channel. But almost as soon as he bid Emmanuel Macron adieu, his critics started questioning his political strategy — and the more than   £500 million the UK agreed to pay France to help patrol its borders.

title: Author Interview: Jenny Odell on Her New Book About Time, the Climate Crisis
description: In her new book, Saving Time: Discovering a Life Beyond the Clock, the bestselling author examines how time impacts the climate crisis and personal dread.

title: Apple TV+ Show ‘Extrapolations’ Takes on Climate Crisis: Review
description: A new series from the writer of Contagion dramatizes life in the not-so-distant future on a warming planet.

title: Weekly Roundup: The Viral Videos in Business, Finance, Health and Tech
description: This week’s Bloomberg Opinion videos are here to help you navigate the world of business, economics, technology and more.

title: No Easy UK-EU Migrant Returns Deal, Sunak Says on Visit to Meet Macron in Paris
description: A deal to return migrants to countries in the European Union can only be agreed in the longer term, UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said, as he met French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris at the first Franco-British summit in five years.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan to Kick Off Toughest Election Campaign of His 20-Year Rule
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan officially kicked off the toughest election campaign of his career on Friday, with the broadest-ever opposition alliance standing between him and a third decade in power.

title: Banking: Why Is the US Regulating JPMorgan But Not SVB?
description: Washington has created a blind spot in an otherwise sound financial system. It should look to China if it wants to reform.

title: Cyril Ramaphosa’s Cabinet Reshuffle May Have Been A Missed Opportunity
description: Welcome to Next Africa, a weekly newsletter on where the continent stands now — and where it’s headed.

title: General Atlantic Says Bubbly Valuations Could Pop This Year
description: Valuations for private companies could plummet by about the second half, as many startups start to run out of cash, according to General Atlantic managing director Sandeep Naik.

title: Podcast: Jeremy Grantham Says Fed Has Been ‘Horror Show’ Since Greenspan
description: The GMO co-founder contends the central bank hasn’t gotten much right and that stocks will keep falling during the current market “meat grinder.”

title: Young People in UK Don’t Drink Alcohol Because It’s ‘Cool Now’
description: A growing number of young Brits are giving up alcohol, driven by a focus on wellbeing and rising costs.

title: UK Pension Funds May Vote Against Shell, BP Directors, FT Says
description: The UK’s Universities Superannuation Scheme and Borders to Coast plan to vote against the renewal of some directors at Shell Plc and BP Plc at their annual meetings if the companies don’t improve their commitments to carbon emission reductions, the Financial Times reported, citing representatives from pension funds.

title: Fed Rate Puzzle Gets Final Pieces With Inflation and Retail Sales
description: Reports this week expected to show still-hot US inflation and a backslide in retail sales round out the last of key economic data markers for Federal Reserve policymakers ahead of their upcoming meeting.

title: China Cabinet Keeps Familiar Faces, New Defense Head: NPC Update
description: As China’s parliament formally unveils its top government officials on Sunday in Beijing, the biggest surprise is how few new faces are added to the cabinet.

title: From Shanghai to Mumbai, Tech Chiefs Race to Contain SVB Fallout
description: Asia’s tech leaders, half a world away from the chaos that’s engulfed Silicon Valley, are scrambling to assess the potential ramifications for an industry that’s always relied heavily on US capital and connections to supercharge growth.

title: China Signals Stability With Surprise Move to Keep PBOC Governor
description: China reappointed several top economic officials in a leadership reshuffle Sunday, giving investors greater continuity as Beijing overhauls financial regulation and grapples with escalating tensions with the US.

title: What Analysts Say About China Keeping Key Economic Officials
description: China’s economic leadership team will retain several familiar faces, a surprise decision that suggests an emphasis on policy consistency as the economy’s recovery faces multiple challenges.

title: Labour Party's Strategy to Beat Tories at Next Election
description: Rishi Sunak’s opponents see a chance to help working parents — and outflank the prime minister.

title: The UK's Remarkably Stable Institutions Are the Secret to Its Success
description: In a world driven increasingly mad by technological innovations, from Twitter to TikTok to ChatGPT, the immutability of Britain’s institutions has never looked more attractive.

title: The Truth About Nord Stream Pipeline Blast, Covid Lab Leak Is Elusive
description: War and plague are ideal breeding grounds for unsolvable mysteries and conspiracy theories.

title: South Korea to Monitor SVB Fallout on Local Markets, Economy
description: South Korea will closely watch for signs of impact on its financial markets and economy from the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, the nation’s finance ministry said Sunday after a meeting of senior officials.

title: Balance of Power Full Show (03/10/2023)
description: Bloomberg: Balance of Power" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show:  Former US Assistant Secretary Mark Kimmitt,  US candidate for President of the World Bank Ajay Banga  and New Jersey Attorney General Matthew Platkin. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Allbirds Shoes: Sales and Stock Fall, CFO Replaced, Store Openings Halted
description: Allbirds Inc. sold investors on a growth story when the sneaker brand went public less than 18 months ago. Those sales gains disappeared in the fourth quarter, tanking its stock.

title: Hints of Systemic Hazard Put an End to 2023 Stock Market Miracle
description: It’s one thing when crypto gets flattened by a fired-up Federal Reserve, or moonshot online stocks fall back to earth as rates soar. But when central bank policy starts biting into banks, investors know they have bigger problems on their hands.

title: Businesses Urge Biden to Use ‘Every Tool’ in Mexico Energy Spat
description: Business groups representing American oil producers, renewable electricity and manufacturers urged the Biden administration to use “every tool available” to push Mexico to address complaints about its nationalist energy policy that the US says violates their free-trade agreement.

title: Silicon Valley Bank Swiftly Collapses After Tech Startups Flee
