title: India G-20: Russia Clears Vladimir Putin’s Schedule for September Summit
description: The Kremlin is opening up Vladimir Putin’s schedule around this year’s G-20 summit in India in September to make it possible for the Russian president to participate in the leaders’ gathering after skipping the last two, according to people familiar with the planning.

title: Glossary of AI Terms: Meaning of GPT, OpenAI, Machine Learning, Chatbots
description: The arrival in late 2022 of the ChatGPT chatbot, with its remarkably sophisticated — if occasionally erroneous — answers to a vast array of queries, was a milestone in artificial intelligence that’s taken decades to reach. Scientists were experimenting with “computer vision” and giving machines the ability to “read” as far back as the 1960s. Chatbots began life when the Beatles were still making music. Today it’s possible to imagine a computer being able to perform most human tasks better than p

title: Global Economy Latest: Resilience and Monetary Tightening
description: Hello. Today we look at how the global economy is still playing catch-up after the pandemic, BOJ Governor Kuroda’s mixed legacy and research suggesting elevated inflation may be around for a while yet.

title: Latvia Begins Shipping Cars Seized From Drunk Drivers to Ukraine
description: Cars seized by Latvian authorities as part of drunk-driving violations are being shipped to Ukraine in an act of solidarity with the war-battered country.

title: US Envoy Calls on Hungary’s Orban to Pivot from Russia ‘Now’
description: The US ambassador to Hungary said Prime Minister Viktor Orban has reached a crossroads and that the “time is now” for him to pivot away from Russia and shore up the country’s relations with its western allies.

title: Made in China Remains Reality for US Clothing Companies
description: Brands are finding few factories outside the country that can produce the quality and quantity they require.

title: Erdogan Warns Turkish Voters of ‘Disaster’ If Opposition Wins
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan warned voters that victory in May elections for the broadest-ever opposition alliance of his 20-year rule would be a catastrophe for the country.

title: Your Saturday Briefing: A Bank Failure Foretold; 2024 Already?
description: Something for the weekend

title: Rishi Sunak’s Small Boats Strategy in English Channel Is a Gamble
description: The British prime minister has made stopping small boats crossing the English Channel one of his five priorities. But members of his own party worry he’ll fail.

title: Xi Cements Hold, Biggest US Bank Failure since 2008 with SVB: Weekend Reads
description: President Xi Jinping completed his shake-up of China’s top personnel this week, with the legislature voting to install a key ally and former aide as premier.

title: Biden's Budget Tax Plan Is Tough for Two-Career Couples
description: The US tax code often penalizes high-earning spouses who earn similar amounts. Biden’s budget could make it even worse.

title: A Surge of Biolabs, Washington’s Economic Gamble: A Week of Big Take
Biden Budget Reflects Old Battle Lines Between Democrats and GOP
description: Republicans continue to fight for smaller government, and Democrats for a more active government, even though their voters don’t necessarily share those goals.

title: Ivy League Athletic Scholarship Lawsuit Exposes Cartel-Like Behavior
description: Plaintiffs say the universities have engaged in price-fixing by agreeing not to offer athletic scholarships. It’s a fair point.

title: Mortgage Rates Aren't Going Anywhere Soon, Homebuyers
description: Homebuyers need to consider that they’ll be living with their interest rate for a lot longer than they hope.

title: Rishi Sunak Paris Success May Not Last: Your Saturday UK Briefing
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.Rishi Sunak ended the week with a deal with France to cut migration via small boats in the English Channel. But almost as soon as he bid Emmanuel Macron adieu, his critics started questioning his political strategy — and the more than   £500 million the UK agreed to pay France to help patrol its borders.

title: Author Interview: Jenny Odell on Her New Book About Time, the Climate Crisis
description: In her new book, Saving Time: Discovering a Life Beyond the Clock, the bestselling author examines how time impacts the climate crisis and personal dread.

title: Apple TV+ Show ‘Extrapolations’ Takes on Climate Crisis: Review
description: A new series from the writer of Contagion dramatizes life in the not-so-distant future on a warming planet.

title: Weekly Roundup: The Viral Videos in Business, Finance, Health and Tech
description: This week’s Bloomberg Opinion videos are here to help you navigate the world of business, economics, technology and more.

title: No Easy UK-EU Migrant Returns Deal, Sunak Says on Visit to Meet Macron in Paris
description: A deal to return migrants to countries in the European Union can only be agreed in the longer term, UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said, as he met French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris at the first Franco-British summit in five years.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan to Kick Off Toughest Election Campaign of His 20-Year Rule
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan officially kicked off the toughest election campaign of his career on Friday, with the broadest-ever opposition alliance standing between him and a third decade in power.

title: Banking: Why Is the US Regulating JPMorgan But Not SVB?
description: Washington has created a blind spot in an otherwise sound financial system. It should look to China if it wants to reform.

title: Cyril Ramaphosa’s Cabinet Reshuffle May Have Been A Missed Opportunity
description: Welcome to Next Africa, a weekly newsletter on where the continent stands now — and where it’s headed.

title: General Atlantic Says Bubbly Valuations Could Pop This Year
description: Valuations for private companies could plummet by about the second half, as many startups start to run out of cash, according to General Atlantic managing director Sandeep Naik.

title: Podcast: Jeremy Grantham Says Fed Has Been ‘Horror Show’ Since Greenspan
description: The GMO co-founder contends the central bank hasn’t gotten much right and that stocks will keep falling during the current market “meat grinder.”

title: Young People in UK Don’t Drink Alcohol Because It’s ‘Cool Now’
description: A growing number of young Brits are giving up alcohol, driven by a focus on wellbeing and rising costs.

title: UK Pension Funds May Vote Against Shell, BP Directors, FT Says
description: The UK’s Universities Superannuation Scheme and Borders to Coast plan to vote against the renewal of some directors at Shell Plc and BP Plc at their annual meetings if the companies don’t improve their commitments to carbon emission reductions, the Financial Times reported, citing representatives from pension funds.

title: Fed Rate Puzzle Gets Final Pieces With Inflation and Retail Sales
description: Reports this week expected to show still-hot US inflation and a backslide in retail sales round out the last of key economic data markers for Federal Reserve policymakers ahead of their upcoming meeting.

title: China Cabinet Keeps Familiar Faces, New Defense Head: NPC Update
description: As China’s parliament formally unveils its top government officials on Sunday in Beijing, the biggest surprise is how few new faces are added to the cabinet.

title: From Shanghai to Mumbai, Tech Chiefs Race to Contain SVB Fallout
description: Asia’s tech leaders, half a world away from the chaos that’s engulfed Silicon Valley, are scrambling to assess the potential ramifications for an industry that’s always relied heavily on US capital and connections to supercharge growth.

title: China Signals Stability With Surprise Move to Keep PBOC Governor
description: China reappointed several top economic officials in a leadership reshuffle Sunday, giving investors greater continuity as Beijing overhauls financial regulation and grapples with escalating tensions with the US.

title: What Analysts Say About China Keeping Key Economic Officials
description: China’s economic leadership team will retain several familiar faces, a surprise decision that suggests an emphasis on policy consistency as the economy’s recovery faces multiple challenges.

title: Labour Party's Strategy to Beat Tories at Next Election
description: Rishi Sunak’s opponents see a chance to help working parents — and outflank the prime minister.

title: The UK's Remarkably Stable Institutions Are the Secret to Its Success
description: In a world driven increasingly mad by technological innovations, from Twitter to TikTok to ChatGPT, the immutability of Britain’s institutions has never looked more attractive.

title: The Truth About Nord Stream Pipeline Blast, Covid Lab Leak Is Elusive
description: War and plague are ideal breeding grounds for unsolvable mysteries and conspiracy theories.

title: South Korea to Monitor SVB Fallout on Local Markets, Economy
description: South Korea will closely watch for signs of impact on its financial markets and economy from the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, the nation’s finance ministry said Sunday after a meeting of senior officials.

title: Balance of Power Full Show (03/10/2023)
description: Bloomberg: Balance of Power" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show:  Former US Assistant Secretary Mark Kimmitt,  US candidate for President of the World Bank Ajay Banga  and New Jersey Attorney General Matthew Platkin. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Allbirds Shoes: Sales and Stock Fall, CFO Replaced, Store Openings Halted
description: Allbirds Inc. sold investors on a growth story when the sneaker brand went public less than 18 months ago. Those sales gains disappeared in the fourth quarter, tanking its stock.

title: Hints of Systemic Hazard Put an End to 2023 Stock Market Miracle
description: It’s one thing when crypto gets flattened by a fired-up Federal Reserve, or moonshot online stocks fall back to earth as rates soar. But when central bank policy starts biting into banks, investors know they have bigger problems on their hands.

title: Businesses Urge Biden to Use ‘Every Tool’ in Mexico Energy Spat
description: Business groups representing American oil producers, renewable electricity and manufacturers urged the Biden administration to use “every tool available” to push Mexico to address complaints about its nationalist energy policy that the US says violates their free-trade agreement.

title: Silicon Valley Bank Swiftly Collapses After Tech Startups Flee
description: Silicon Valley Bank became the biggest US lender to fail in more than a decade after a tumultuous week that saw an unsuccessful attempt to raise capital and a cash exodus from the tech startups that had fueled the lender’s rise.

title: SVB (SIVB) Collapse: The FDIC-Insured Bank Is the Biggest Failure Since 2008
description: It’s the biggest failure of a US bank in more than a decade — and an illustration of the power of the startup hive mind.

title: Daylight Saving Time: Maps Show Why We Disagree About 'Spring Forward'
description: It’s time to change our clocks, again. These maps reveal why making daylight saving time permanent is more controversial than it seems.

title: SVB Collapse: Silicon Valley Bank Failure Isn’t Regulators’ Fault
description: Banks are supposed to take risks. Sometimes it doesn’t go well.

title: Who Are SVB’s Banking Rivals? First National, Mercury, JPMorgan Stand to Gain
description: A few banks benefited from some startups that withdrew funds from the now-failed Silicon Valley Bank.

title: Industrial Strength: Schneider Electric Wants to Be Your Digital Consultant
description: Schneider Electric is turning its software expertise into a consulting business for other industrial companies.

title: Week's Best Reads: Sydney's Rookie Traders, India's Gay Marriage Decision
description: In the ongoing fight for equality, the women of Iran are standing up against the Islamic country’s chafing dress code, while the work of a few brave souls could extend same-sex marriage rights to more than a billion people. China is pushing to end an antiquated wedding tradition in hopes of reversing a population decline, as Hong Kong debates whether Covid camps could help its housing crisis.

title: Bank Rout: It's a Curveball for Markets Anxious About the Outlook
description: Signs of banking distress are jolting bonds and adding to the litany of worries for investors figuring out where the US economy is at.

title: UK Worker Shortage: How to Soften the Blow of Premature Retirement
description: Many Brits are being forced out of work due to ill health. Here’s advice for making less money last longer.

title: Treasuries Surge as Bond Bulls Seize on Bank Fears, Jobless Data
description: Investors sought the safety of bonds for a second day as jitters over a rout in bank stocks hit risk sentiment and traders speculated that rate-hike bets had gone too far too fast.

title: GM Offers Buyouts to Accelerate $2 Billion Cost Cutting Plan
description: General Motors Co. said it’s offering voluntary buyouts to the majority of salaried staff as part of a plan announced in January to cut $2 billion in annual costs.

title: US Planned Layoffs Jump to Mark Worst Start to a Year Since 2009
description: Layoffs announced by US employers quintupled in February from a year earlier and were the largest at the start of any year since 2009, led by technology companies.

title: Why ‘MasterChef’ Contestant Nick DiGiovanni Said No to Harvard Business School
description: Harvard grad Nick DiGiovanni decided that he didn’t need an MBA.

title: US Jobless Claims Jump to 211,000, Led by New York, California
description: Applications for US unemployment benefits last week rose to the highest since December, driven by spikes in California and New York and suggesting some softening in what’s still a tight labor market.

title: ADIA Said to Near Buying $500 Million Stake in India’s Lenskart
description: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority is nearing a deal to acquire a stake in Indian eyewear startup Lenskart Solutions Pvt. for about $500 million, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: How Much Do Traders Earn in Australia? Some New Graduates Get $400,000
description: Graduate traders are earning salaries of as much as $400,000 straight out of school.

title: Norway’s Statistics Office Sees Growth Returning to Normal Pace
Asia Stocks Set for Worst Day in Five Months as Financials Slide
description: Asian stocks slumped, with financials leading a region-wide selloff, as investors fretted over the risks to broader markets from troubles emanating at a Silicon Valley-based lender. Continued losses in Chinese equities added to the weakness.

title: Bank Rout: It's a Curveball for Markets Anxious About the Outlook
description: Signs of banking distress are jolting bonds and adding to the litany of worries for investors figuring out where the US economy is at.

title: NATO Need for Weapons for Ukraine War Offers Hope to Town That Armed Soviet Bloc
description: Czechoslovakia’s defense industry collapsed when the Cold War ended. Now companies are reviving plants that once supplied the Warsaw Pact.

title: Jeremy Hunt Looks to Bring UK’s Older Workers Back Into Jobs
description: As Britain battles rip-roaring inflation, fueled by a shortage of staff, one cohort of workers is notably missing in action from the labor force.

title: Treasuries Surge as Bond Bulls Seize on Bank Fears, Jobless Data
description: Investors sought the safety of bonds for a second day as jitters over a rout in bank stocks hit risk sentiment and traders speculated that rate-hike bets had gone too far too fast.

title: Gold (XAUUSD) Gets Ringing Endorsement as Singapore Boosts Bullion Reserves 30%
description: Singapore boosted its gold reserves by about 30% in January, joining central banks from China to Turkey in building up holdings of the precious metal.

title: Bloomberg Evening Briefing: The Inflation See-Saw Continues
description: Get caught up.

title: Banks Forced to Up CD Rates to Stanch Deposit Bleeding
description: US banks are being forced to do something they haven’t done for 15 years: fight for deposits.

title: China Covid Zero Switch Caused Mass Death, Distrust in Xi
description: After imposing three years of sacrifice, Xi Jinping’s government let Covid tear through the population in two months. Moving on won’t be easy.

title: Apple’s (AAPL) Stock Gets Its Mojo Back, Leading Mega-Cap Peers
description: After a shaky start to the year, Apple Inc.’s stock has once again reclaimed the mantle of the go-to investment in Big Tech, even winning support from Goldman Sachs Group Inc. after years in which the brokerage refrained from recommending the shares.

title: Is an RV Downturn the Same Recession Signal as Before?
description: The industry, an economic bellwether in the past, is experiencing sharp sales declines. But after an epic pandemic buying boom, that may have been inevitable.

title: Xi Reigns Supreme in China After His Reelection as President
description: For five years, much of Chinese politics has turned on Xi Jinping’s unrelenting quest for a third term. Now he’s got to own it.

title: BofA’s Hartnett Sees Stocks Stuck on Fed Until Recession Evident
description: US stocks hanging on Federal Reserve policy signals are boxed in a “neurotic” trading range that will only break once economic data unambiguously point to a recession, Bank of America Corp. strategists say.

title: Thai Tuna Shipper May Exit Red Lobster Chain as Losses Mount
description: Thai Union Group Pcl, one of the world’s biggest makers of canned tuna, is considering an exit from its loss-making Red Lobster unit less than three years after boosting its stake in the US restaurant chain.

title: GoTo to Cut 600 More Jobs as Southeast Asia Tech Firms Retrench
description: Indonesia’s GoTo Group is reducing 600 more jobs, accelerating its cuts in Southeast Asia as growth in the region’s internet markets slows.

title: Bank Rout: It's a Curveball for Markets Anxious About the Outlook
description: Signs of banking distress are jolting bonds and adding to the litany of worries for investors figuring out where the US economy is at.

title: Crypto Bros Turn Back Time on Their Rolexes, Patek Philippes
description: Many of those who bought luxury timepieces during the boom of 2022 have been forced to sell. But those bargains might soon run out.

title: Boris Johnson Honours List: Nepo Parents Shouldn’t Surprise UK at This Point
description: The former prime minister may be causing the latest dismay, but much of Britain’s political class no longer knows how to behave.

title: ECB Seen Taking Rates to 3.75% Peak as Bond Exit Set to Quicken
description: The European Central Bank will step up its fight against stubborn inflation by raising interest rates four more times and unwinding its €5 trillion ($5.3 trillion) bond portfolio at a quicker pace, according to a Bloomberg survey of economists.

title: Biden Should Be Wary of Saudi Crown Prince MBS's Overture on Abraham Accords
description: The White House should pause to consider what’s behind this 180-degree turn — and why it’s coming now.

title: Putin Decree Puts Popular Route Out of Russian Assets on Pause
description: New Russian rules are complicating a popular route for investors to exit their holdings by selling their securities to brokerages in so-called friendly nations.

description: Signs of banking distress are jolting bonds and adding to the litany of worries for investors figuring out where the US economy is at.

description: Czechoslovakia’s defense industry collapsed when the Cold War ended. Now companies are reviving plants that once supplied the Warsaw Pact.

title: Jeremy Hunt Looks to Bring UK’s Older Workers Back Into Jobs
description: As Britain battles rip-roaring inflation, fueled by a shortage of staff, one cohort of workers is notably missing in action from the labor force.

title: Treasuries Surge as Bond Bulls Seize on Bank Fears, Jobless Data
description: Investors sought the safety of bonds for a second day as jitters over a rout in bank stocks hit risk sentiment and traders speculated that rate-hike bets had gone too far too fast.

description: Singapore boosted its gold reserves by about 30% in January, joining central banks from China to Turkey in building up holdings of the precious metal.

description: Get caught up.

title: Banks Forced to Up CD Rates to Stanch Deposit Bleeding
description: US banks are being forced to do something they haven’t done for 15 years: fight for deposits.

description: After imposing three years of sacrifice, Xi Jinping’s government let Covid tear through the population in two months. Moving on won’t be easy.

title: Apple’s (AAPL) Stock Gets Its Mojo Back, Leading Mega-Cap Peers
description: After a shaky start to the year, Apple Inc.’s stock has once again reclaimed the mantle of the go-to investment in Big Tech, even winning support from Goldman Sachs Group Inc. after years in which the brokerage refrained from recommending the shares.

title: Is an RV Downturn the Same Recession Signal as Before?
description: The industry, an economic bellwether in the past, is experiencing sharp sales declines. But after an epic pandemic buying boom, that may have been inevitable.

description: For five years, much of Chinese politics has turned on Xi Jinping’s unrelenting quest for a third term. Now he’s got to own it.

title: BofA’s Hartnett Sees Stocks Stuck on Fed Until Recession Evident
description: US stocks hanging on Federal Reserve policy signals are boxed in a “neurotic” trading range that will only break once economic data unambiguously point to a recession, Bank of America Corp. strategists say.

title: Thai Tuna Shipper May Exit Red Lobster Chain as Losses Mount
description: Thai Union Group Pcl, one of the world’s biggest makers of canned tuna, is considering an exit from its loss-making Red Lobster unit less than three years after boosting its stake in the US restaurant chain.

description: The White House should pause to consider what’s behind this 180-degree turn — and why it’s coming now.

title: Glossary of AI Terms: Meaning of GPT, OpenAI, Machine Learning, Chatbots
description: The arrival in late 2022 of the ChatGPT chatbot, with its remarkably sophisticated — if occasionally erroneous — answers to a vast array of queries, was a milestone in artificial intelligence that’s taken decades to reach. title: Global Economy Latest: Resilience and Monetary Tightening
description: Hello. Today we look at how the global economy is still playing catch-up after the pandemic, BOJ Governor Kuroda’s mixed legacy and research suggesting elevated inflation may be around for a while yet.

title: Latvia Begins Shipping Cars Seized From Drunk Drivers to Ukraine
description: Cars seized by Latvian authorities as part of drunk-driving violations are being shipped to Ukraine in an act of solidarity with the war-battered country.

title: US Envoy Calls on Hungary’s Orban to Pivot from Russia ‘Now’
description: The US ambassador to Hungary said Prime Minister Viktor Orban has reached a crossroads and that the “time is now” for him to pivot away from Russia and shore up the country’s relations with its western allies.

title: Made in China Remains Reality for US Clothing Companies
description: Brands are finding few factories outside the country that can produce the quality and quantity they require.

description: Something for the weekend

description: The British prime minister has made stopping small boats crossing the English Channel one of his five priorities. But members of his own party worry he’ll fail.

description: President Xi Jinping completed his shake-up of China’s top personnel this week, with the legislature voting to install a key ally and former aide as premier.

description: Republicans continue to fight for smaller government, and Democrats for a more active government, even though their voters don’t necessarily share those goals.

description: Plaintiffs say the universities have engaged in price-fixing by agreeing not to offer athletic scholarships. It’s a fair point.

description: Homebuyers need to consider that they’ll be living with their interest rate for a lot longer than they hope.

title: Rishi Sunak Paris Success May Not Last: Your Saturday UK Briefing
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.Rishi Sunak ended the week with a deal with France to cut migration via small boats in the English Channel. But almost as soon as he bid Emmanuel Macron adieu, his critics started questioning his political strategy — and the more than   £500 million the UK agreed to pay France to help patrol its borders.

title: Author Interview: Jenny Odell on Her New Book About Time, the Climate Crisis
description: In her new book, Saving Time: Discovering a Life Beyond the Clock, the bestselling author examines how time impacts the climate crisis and personal dread.

description: A new series from the writer of Contagion dramatizes life in the not-so-distant future on a warming planet.

title: Weekly Roundup: The Viral Videos in Business, Finance, Health and Tech
description: This week’s Bloomberg Opinion videos are here to help you navigate the world of business, economics, technology and more.

title: No Easy UK-EU Migrant Returns Deal, Sunak Says on Visit to Meet Macron in Paris
description: A deal to return migrants to countries in the European Union can only be agreed in the longer term, UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said, as he met French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris at the first Franco-British summit in five years.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan to Kick Off Toughest Election Campaign of His 20-Year Rule
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan officially kicked off the toughest election campaign of his career on Friday, with the broadest-ever opposition alliance standing between him and a third decade in power.

title: Banking: Why Is the US Regulating JPMorgan But Not SVB?
description: Washington has created a blind spot in an otherwise sound financial system. It should look to China if it wants to reform.

title: Cyril Ramaphosa’s Cabinet Reshuffle May Have Been A Missed Opportunity
description: Welcome to Next Africa, a weekly newsletter on where the continent stands now — and where it’s headed.

title: General Atlantic Says Bubbly Valuations Could Pop This Year
description: Valuations for private companies could plummet by about the second half, as many startups start to run out of cash, according to General Atlantic managing director Sandeep Naik.

title: Podcast: Jeremy Grantham Says Fed Has Been ‘Horror Show’ Since Greenspan
description: The GMO co-founder contends the central bank hasn’t gotten much right and that stocks will keep falling during the current market “meat grinder.”

title: Young People in UK Don’t Drink Alcohol Because It’s ‘Cool Now’
description: A growing number of young Brits are giving up alcohol, driven by a focus on wellbeing and rising costs.

title: UK Pension Funds May Vote Against Shell, BP Directors, FT Says
description: The UK’s Universities Superannuation Scheme and Borders to Coast plan to vote against the renewal of some directors at Shell Plc and BP Plc at their annual meetings if the companies don’t improve their commitments to carbon emission reductions, the Financial Times reported, citing representatives from pension funds.

title: Fed Rate Puzzle Gets Final Pieces With Inflation and Retail Sales
description: Reports this week expected to show still-hot US inflation and a backslide in retail sales round out the last of key economic data markers for Federal Reserve policymakers ahead of their upcoming meeting.

title: China Cabinet Keeps Familiar Faces, New Defense Head: NPC Update
description: As China’s parliament formally unveils its top government officials on Sunday in Beijing, the biggest surprise is how few new faces are added to the cabinet.

title: From Shanghai to Mumbai, Tech Chiefs Race to Contain SVB Fallout
description: Asia’s tech leaders, half a world away from the chaos that’s engulfed Silicon Valley, are scrambling to assess the potential ramifications for an industry that’s always relied heavily on US capital and connections to supercharge growth.

title: China Signals Stability With Surprise Move to Keep PBOC Governor
description: China reappointed several top economic officials in a leadership reshuffle Sunday, giving investors greater continuity as Beijing overhauls financial regulation and grapples with escalating tensions with the US.

title: What Analysts Say About China Keeping Key Economic Officials
description: China’s economic leadership team will retain several familiar faces, a surprise decision that suggests an emphasis on policy consistency as the economy’s recovery faces multiple challenges.

title: Labour Party's Strategy to Beat Tories at Next Election
description: Rishi Sunak’s opponents see a chance to help working parents — and outflank the prime minister.

title: The UK's Remarkably Stable Institutions Are the Secret to Its Success
description: In a world driven increasingly mad by technological innovations, from Twitter to TikTok to ChatGPT, the immutability of Britain’s institutions has never looked more attractive.

title: The Truth About Nord Stream Pipeline Blast, Covid Lab Leak Is Elusive
description: War and plague are ideal breeding grounds for unsolvable mysteries and conspiracy theories.

title: South Korea to Monitor SVB Fallout on Local Markets, Economy
description: South Korea will closely watch for signs of impact on its financial markets and economy from the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, the nation’s finance ministry said Sunday after a meeting of senior officials.

title: Balance of Power Full Show (03/10/2023)
description: Bloomberg: Balance of Power" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show:  Former US Assistant Secretary Mark Kimmitt,  US candidate for President of the World Bank Ajay Banga  and New Jersey Attorney General Matthew Platkin. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Allbirds Shoes: Sales and Stock Fall, CFO Replaced, Store Openings Halted
description: Allbirds Inc. sold investors on a growth story when the sneaker brand went public less than 18 months ago. Those sales gains disappeared in the fourth quarter, tanking its stock.

title: Hints of Systemic Hazard Put an End to 2023 Stock Market Miracle
description: It’s one thing when crypto gets flattened by a fired-up Federal Reserve, or moonshot online stocks fall back to earth as rates soar. But when central bank policy starts biting into banks, investors know they have bigger problems on their hands.

title: Businesses Urge Biden to Use ‘Every Tool’ in Mexico Energy Spat
description: Business groups representing American oil producers, renewable electricity and manufacturers urged the Biden administration to use “every tool available” to push Mexico to address complaints about its nationalist energy policy that the US says violates their free-trade agreement.

title: Silicon Valley Bank Swiftly Collapses After Tech Startups Flee
description: Silicon Valley Bank became the biggest US lender to fail in more than a decade after a tumultuous week that saw an unsuccessful attempt to raise capital and a cash exodus from the tech startups that had fueled the lender’s rise.

title: SVB (SIVB) Collapse: The FDIC-Insured Bank Is the Biggest Failure Since 2008
description: It’s the biggest failure of a US bank in more than a decade — and an illustration of the power of the startup hive mind.

title: Daylight Saving Time: Maps Show Why We Disagree About 'Spring Forward'
description: It’s time to change our clocks, again. These maps reveal why making daylight saving time permanent is more controversial than it seems.

title: SVB Collapse: Silicon Valley Bank Failure Isn’t Regulators’ Fault
description: Banks are supposed to take risks. Sometimes it doesn’t go well.

title: Who Are SVB’s Banking Rivals? First National, Mercury, JPMorgan Stand to Gain
description: A few banks benefited from some startups that withdrew funds from the now-failed Silicon Valley Bank.

title: Industrial Strength: Schneider Electric Wants to Be Your Digital Consultant
description: Schneider Electric is turning its software expertise into a consulting business for other industrial companies.

title: Week's Best Reads: Sydney's Rookie Traders, India's Gay Marriage Decision
description: In the ongoing fight for equality, the women of Iran are standing up against the Islamic country’s chafing dress code, while the work of a few brave souls could extend same-sex marriage rights to more than a billion people. China is pushing to end an antiquated wedding tradition in hopes of reversing a population decline, as Hong Kong debates whether Covid camps could help its housing crisis.

description: Investors sought the safety of bonds for a second day as jitters over a rout in bank stocks hit risk sentiment and traders speculated that rate-hike bets had gone too far too fast.

title: GM Offers Buyouts to Accelerate $2 Billion Cost Cutting Plan

title: US Planned Layoffs Jump to Mark Worst Start to a Year Since 2009
description: Layoffs announced by US employers quintupled in February from a year earlier and were the largest at the start of any year since 2009, led by technology companies.

description: Allbirds Inc. sold investors on a growth story when the sneaker brand went public less than 18 months ago. Those sales gains disappeared in the fourth quarter, tanking its stock.

title: Hints of Systemic Hazard Put an End to 2023 Stock Market Miracle
description: It’s one thing when crypto gets flattened by a fired-up Federal Reserve, or moonshot online stocks fall back to earth as rates soar. But when central bank policy starts biting into banks, investors know they have bigger problems on their hands.

title: Businesses Urge Biden to Use ‘Every Tool’ in Mexico Energy Spat
description: Business groups representing American oil producers, renewable electricity and manufacturers urged the Biden administration to use “every tool available” to push Mexico to address complaints about its nationalist energy policy that the US says violates their free-trade agreement.

title: Silicon Valley Bank Swiftly Collapses After Tech Startups Flee
description: Silicon Valley Bank became the biggest US lender to fail in more than a decade after a tumultuous week that saw an unsuccessful attempt to raise capital and a cash exodus from the tech startups that had fueled the lender’s rise.

title: SVB (SIVB) Collapse: The FDIC-Insured Bank Is the Biggest Failure Since 2008
description: It’s the biggest failure of a US bank in more than a decade — and an illustration of the power of the startup hive mind.

title: Daylight Saving Time: Maps Show Why We Disagree About 'Spring Forward'
description: It’s time to change our clocks, again. These maps reveal why making daylight saving time permanent is more controversial than it seems.

title: SVB Collapse: Silicon Valley Bank Failure Isn’t Regulators’ Fault
description: Banks are supposed to take risks. Sometimes it doesn’t go well.

title: Who Are SVB’s Banking Rivals? First National, Mercury, JPMorgan Stand to Gain
description: A few banks benefited from some startups that withdrew funds from the now-failed Silicon Valley Bank.

title: Industrial Strength: Schneider Electric Wants to Be Your Digital Consultant
description: Schneider Electric is turning its software expertise into a consulting business for other industrial companies.

title: Week's Best Reads: Sydney's Rookie Traders, India's Gay Marriage Decision
description: In the ongoing fight for equality, the women of Iran are standing up against the Islamic country’s chafing dress code, while the work of a few brave souls could extend same-sex marriage rights to more than a billion people. China is pushing to end an antiquated wedding tradition in hopes of reversing a population decline, as Hong Kong debates whether Covid camps could help its housing crisis.

title: Bank Rout: It's a Curveball for Markets Anxious About the Outlook
description: Signs of banking distress are jolting bonds and adding to the litany of worries for investors figuring out where the US economy is at.

title: UK Worker Shortage: How to Soften the Blow of Premature Retirement
description: Many Brits are being forced out of work due to ill health. Here’s advice for making less money last longer.

title: Treasuries Surge as Bond Bulls Seize on Bank Fears, Jobless Data
description: Investors sought the safety of bonds for a second day as jitters over a rout in bank stocks hit risk sentiment and traders speculated that rate-hike bets had gone too far too fast.

title: GM Offers Buyouts to Accelerate $2 Billion Cost Cutting Plan
description: General Motors Co. said it’s offering voluntary buyouts to the majority of salaried staff as part of a plan announced in January to cut $2 billion in annual costs.

title: US Planned Layoffs Jump to Mark Worst Start to a Year Since 2009
description: Layoffs announced by US employers quintupled in February from a year earlier and were the largest at the start of any year since 2009, led by technology companies.

title: Why ‘MasterChef’ Contestant Nick DiGiovanni Said No to Harvard Business School
description: Harvard grad Nick DiGiovanni decided that he didn’t need an MBA.

title: US Jobless Claims Jump to 211,000, Led by New York, California
description: Applications for US unemployment benefits last week rose to the highest since December, driven by spikes in California and New York and suggesting some softening in what’s still a tight labor market.

title: ADIA Said to Near Buying $500 Million Stake in India’s Lenskart
description: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority is nearing a deal to acquire a stake in Indian eyewear startup Lenskart Solutions Pvt. for about $500 million, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: How Much Do Traders Earn in Australia? Some New Graduates Get $400,000
description: Graduate traders are earning salaries of as much as $400,000 straight out of school.

title: Norway’s Statistics Office Sees Growth Returning to Normal Pace
Asia Stocks Set for Worst Day in Five Months as Financials Slide
description: Asian stocks slumped, with financials leading a region-wide selloff, as investors fretted over the risks to broader markets from troubles emanating at a Silicon Valley-based lender. Continued losses in Chinese equities added to the weakness.

title: Bank Rout: It's a Curveball for Markets Anxious About the Outlook
description: Signs of banking distress are jolting bonds and adding to the litany of worries for investors figuring out where the US economy is at.

title: NATO Need for Weapons for Ukraine War Offers Hope to Town That Armed Soviet Bloc
description: Czechoslovakia’s defense industry collapsed when the Cold War ended. Now companies are reviving plants that once supplied the Warsaw Pact.

title: Jeremy Hunt Looks to Bring UK’s Older Workers Back Into Jobs
description: As Britain battles rip-roaring inflation, fueled by a shortage of staff, one cohort of workers is notably missing in action from the labor force.

title: Treasuries Surge as Bond Bulls Seize on Bank Fears, Jobless Data
description: Investors sought the safety of bonds for a second day as jitters over a rout in bank stocks hit risk sentiment and traders speculated that rate-hike bets had gone too far too fast.

title: Gold (XAUUSD) Gets Ringing Endorsement as Singapore Boosts Bullion Reserves 30%
description: Singapore boosted its gold reserves by about 30% in January, joining central banks from China to Turkey in building up holdings of the precious metal.

title: Bloomberg Evening Briefing: The Inflation See-Saw Continues
description: Get caught up.

title: Banks Forced to Up CD Rates to Stanch Deposit Bleeding
description: US banks are being forced to do something they haven’t done for 15 years: fight for deposits.

title: China Covid Zero Switch Caused Mass Death, Distrust in Xi
description: After imposing three years of sacrifice, Xi Jinping’s government let Covid tear through the population in two months. Moving on won’t be easy.

title: Apple’s (AAPL) Stock Gets Its Mojo Back, Leading Mega-Cap Peers
description: After a shaky start to the year, Apple Inc.’s stock has once again reclaimed the mantle of the go-to investment in Big Tech, even winning support from Goldman Sachs Group Inc. after years in which the brokerage refrained from recommending the shares.

title: Is an RV Downturn the Same Recession Signal as Before?
description: The industry, an economic bellwether in the past, is experiencing sharp sales declines. But after an epic pandemic buying boom, that may have been inevitable.

title: Xi Reigns Supreme in China After His Reelection as President
description: For five years, much of Chinese politics has turned on Xi Jinping’s unrelenting quest for a third term. Now he’s got to own it.

title: BofA’s Hartnett Sees Stocks Stuck on Fed Until Recession Evident
description: US stocks hanging on Federal Reserve policy signals are boxed in a “neurotic” trading range that will only break once economic data unambiguously point to a recession, Bank of America Corp. strategists say.

title: Thai Tuna Shipper May Exit Red Lobster Chain as Losses Mount
description: Thai Union Group Pcl, one of the world’s biggest makers of canned tuna, is considering an exit from its loss-making Red Lobster unit less than three years after boosting its stake in the US restaurant chain.

title: GoTo to Cut 600 More Jobs as Southeast Asia Tech Firms Retrench
description: Indonesia’s GoTo Group is reducing 600 more jobs, accelerating its cuts in Southeast Asia as growth in the region’s internet markets slows.

title: Bank Rout: It's a Curveball for Markets Anxious About the Outlook
description: Signs of banking distress are jolting bonds and adding to the litany of worries for investors figuring out where the US economy is at.

title: Crypto Bros Turn Back Time on Their Rolexes, Patek Philippes
description: Many of those who bought luxury timepieces during the boom of 2022 have been forced to sell. But those bargains might soon run out.

title: Boris Johnson Honours List: Nepo Parents Shouldn’t Surprise UK at This Point
description: The former prime minister may be causing the latest dismay, but much of Britain’s political class no longer knows how to behave.

title: ECB Seen Taking Rates to 3.75% Peak as Bond Exit Set to Quicken
description: The European Central Bank will step up its fight against stubborn inflation by raising interest rates four more times and unwinding its €5 trillion ($5.3 trillion) bond portfolio at a quicker pace, according to a Bloomberg survey of economists.

title: Biden Should Be Wary of Saudi Crown Prince MBS's Overture on Abraham Accords
description: The White House should pause to consider what’s behind this 180-degree turn — and why it’s coming now.

title: Putin Decree Puts Popular Route Out of Russian Assets on Pause
description: New Russian rules are complicating a popular route for investors to exit their holdings by selling their securities to brokerages in so-called friendly nations.

title: Bloomberg UK Politics: From Russia, With Money (Podcast)
description: Source: Bloomberg, 33:40

title: High-Tech Magnets Will Be Minting Tomorrow’s Billionaires
description: “Lodestones” started out as lightning-infused magical rocks that could cure baldness. Now they’re an essential part of our machine-driven world.

title: India G-20: Russia Clears Vladimir Putin’s Schedule for September Summit
description: The Kremlin is opening up Vladimir Putin’s schedule around this year’s G-20 summit in India in September to make it possible for the Russian president to participate in the leaders’ gathering after skipping the last two, according to people familiar with the planning.

title: Glossary of AI Terms: Meaning of GPT, OpenAI, Machine Learning, Chatbots
description: The arrival in late 2022 of the ChatGPT chatbot, with its remarkably sophisticated — if occasionally erroneous — answers to a vast array of queries, was a milestone in artificial intelligence that’s taken decades to reach. Scientists were experimenting with “computer vision” and giving machines the ability to “read” as far back as the 1960s. Chatbots began life when the Beatles were still making music. Today it’s possible to imagine a computer being able to perform most human tasks better than p

title: Global Economy Latest: Resilience and Monetary Tightening
description: Hello. Today we look at how the global economy is still playing catch-up after the pandemic, BOJ Governor Kuroda’s mixed legacy and research suggesting elevated inflation may be around for a while yet.

title: Latvia Begins Shipping Cars Seized From Drunk Drivers to Ukraine
description: Cars seized by Latvian authorities as part of drunk-driving violations are being shipped to Ukraine in an act of solidarity with the war-battered country.

title: US Envoy Calls on Hungary’s Orban to Pivot from Russia ‘Now’
description: The US ambassador to Hungary said Prime Minister Viktor Orban has reached a crossroads and that the “time is now” for him to pivot away from Russia and shore up the country’s relations with its western allies.

title: Made in China Remains Reality for US Clothing Companies
description: Brands are finding few factories outside the country that can produce the quality and quantity they require.

title: Erdogan Warns Turkish Voters of ‘Disaster’ If Opposition Wins
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan warned voters that victory in May elections for the broadest-ever opposition alliance of his 20-year rule would be a catastrophe for the country.

title: Your Saturday Briefing: A Bank Failure Foretold; 2024 Already?
description: Something for the weekend

title: Rishi Sunak’s Small Boats Strategy in English Channel Is a Gamble
description: The British prime minister has made stopping small boats crossing the English Channel one of his five priorities. But members of his own party worry he’ll fail.

title: Xi Cements Hold, Biggest US Bank Failure since 2008 with SVB: Weekend Reads
description: President Xi Jinping completed his shake-up of China’s top personnel this week, with the legislature voting to install a key ally and former aide as premier.

title: Biden's Budget Tax Plan Is Tough for Two-Career Couples
description: The US tax code often penalizes high-earning spouses who earn similar amounts. Biden’s budget could make it even worse.

title: A Surge of Biolabs, Washington’s Economic Gamble: A Week of Big Take
Biden Budget Reflects Old Battle Lines Between Democrats and GOP
description: Republicans continue to fight for smaller government, and Democrats for a more active government, even though their voters don’t necessarily share those goals.

title: Ivy League Athletic Scholarship Lawsuit Exposes Cartel-Like Behavior
description: Plaintiffs say the universities have engaged in price-fixing by agreeing not to offer athletic scholarships. It’s a fair point.

title: Mortgage Rates Aren't Going Anywhere Soon, Homebuyers
description: Homebuyers need to consider that they’ll be living with their interest rate for a lot longer than they hope.

title: Rishi Sunak Paris Success May Not Last: Your Saturday UK Briefing
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.Rishi Sunak ended the week with a deal with France to cut migration via small boats in the English Channel. But almost as soon as he bid Emmanuel Macron adieu, his critics started questioning his political strategy — and the more than   £500 million the UK agreed to pay France to help patrol its borders.

title: Author Interview: Jenny Odell on Her New Book About Time, the Climate Crisis
description: In her new book, Saving Time: Discovering a Life Beyond the Clock, the bestselling author examines how time impacts the climate crisis and personal dread.

title: Apple TV+ Show ‘Extrapolations’ Takes on Climate Crisis: Review
description: A new series from the writer of Contagion dramatizes life in the not-so-distant future on a warming planet.

title: Weekly Roundup: The Viral Videos in Business, Finance, Health and Tech
description: This week’s Bloomberg Opinion videos are here to help you navigate the world of business, economics, technology and more.

title: No Easy UK-EU Migrant Returns Deal, Sunak Says on Visit to Meet Macron in Paris
description: A deal to return migrants to countries in the European Union can only be agreed in the longer term, UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said, as he met French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris at the first Franco-British summit in five years.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan to Kick Off Toughest Election Campaign of His 20-Year Rule
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan officially kicked off the toughest election campaign of his career on Friday, with the broadest-ever opposition alliance standing between him and a third decade in power.

title: Banking: Why Is the US Regulating JPMorgan But Not SVB?
description: Washington has created a blind spot in an otherwise sound financial system. It should look to China if it wants to reform.

title: Cyril Ramaphosa’s Cabinet Reshuffle May Have Been A Missed Opportunity
description: Welcome to Next Africa, a weekly newsletter on where the continent stands now — and where it’s headed.

title: General Atlantic Says Bubbly Valuations Could Pop This Year
description: Valuations for private companies could plummet by about the second half, as many startups start to run out of cash, according to General Atlantic managing director Sandeep Naik.

title: Podcast: Jeremy Grantham Says Fed Has Been ‘Horror Show’ Since Greenspan
description: The GMO co-founder contends the central bank hasn’t gotten much right and that stocks will keep falling during the current market “meat grinder.”

title: Young People in UK Don’t Drink Alcohol Because It’s ‘Cool Now’
description: A growing number of young Brits are giving up alcohol, driven by a focus on wellbeing and rising costs.

title: UK Pension Funds May Vote Against Shell, BP Directors, FT Says
description: The UK’s Universities Superannuation Scheme and Borders to Coast plan to vote against the renewal of some directors at Shell Plc and BP Plc at their annual meetings if the companies don’t improve their commitments to carbon emission reductions, the Financial Times reported, citing representatives from pension funds.

title: Fed Rate Puzzle Gets Final Pieces With Inflation and Retail Sales
description: Reports this week expected to show still-hot US inflation and a backslide in retail sales round out the last of key economic data markers for Federal Reserve policymakers ahead of their upcoming meeting.

title: China Cabinet Keeps Familiar Faces, New Defense Head: NPC Update
description: As China’s parliament formally unveils its top government officials on Sunday in Beijing, the biggest surprise is how few new faces are added to the cabinet.

title: From Shanghai to Mumbai, Tech Chiefs Race to Contain SVB Fallout
description: Asia’s tech leaders, half a world away from the chaos that’s engulfed Silicon Valley, are scrambling to assess the potential ramifications for an industry that’s always relied heavily on US capital and connections to supercharge growth.

title: China Signals Stability With Surprise Move to Keep PBOC Governor
description: China reappointed several top economic officials in a leadership reshuffle Sunday, giving investors greater continuity as Beijing overhauls financial regulation and grapples with escalating tensions with the US.

title: What Analysts Say About China Keeping Key Economic Officials
description: China’s economic leadership team will retain several familiar faces, a surprise decision that suggests an emphasis on policy consistency as the economy’s recovery faces multiple challenges.

title: Labour Party's Strategy to Beat Tories at Next Election
description: Rishi Sunak’s opponents see a chance to help working parents — and outflank the prime minister.

title: The UK's Remarkably Stable Institutions Are the Secret to Its Success
description: In a world driven increasingly mad by technological innovations, from Twitter to TikTok to ChatGPT, the immutability of Britain’s institutions has never looked more attractive.

title: The Truth About Nord Stream Pipeline Blast, Covid Lab Leak Is Elusive
description: War and plague are ideal breeding grounds for unsolvable mysteries and conspiracy theories.

title: South Korea to Monitor SVB Fallout on Local Markets, Economy
description: South Korea will closely watch for signs of impact on its financial markets and economy from the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, the nation’s finance ministry said Sunday after a meeting of senior officials.

title: India G-20: Russia Clears Vladimir Putin’s Schedule for September Summit
description: The Kremlin is opening up Vladimir Putin’s schedule around this year’s G-20 summit in India in September to make it possible for the Russian president to participate in the leaders’ gathering after skipping the last two, according to people familiar with the planning.

title: Glossary of AI Terms: Meaning of GPT, OpenAI, Machine Learning, Chatbots
description: The arrival in late 2022 of the ChatGPT chatbot, with its remarkably sophisticated — if occasionally erroneous — answers to a vast array of queries, was a milestone in artificial intelligence that’s taken decades to reach. Scientists were experimenting with “computer vision” and giving machines the ability to “read” as far back as the 1960s. Chatbots began life when the Beatles were still making music. title: Global Economy Latest: Resilience and Monetary Tightening
description: Hello. Today we look at how the global economy is still playing catch-up after the pandemic, BOJ Governor Kuroda’s mixed legacy and research suggesting elevated inflation may be around for a while yet.

title: Latvia Begins Shipping Cars Seized From Drunk Drivers to Ukraine
description: Cars seized by Latvian authorities as part of drunk-driving violations are being shipped to Ukraine in an act of solidarity with the war-battered country.

title: US Envoy Calls on Hungary’s Orban to Pivot from Russia ‘Now’

title: Rishi Sunak Paris Success May Not Last: Your Saturday UK Briefing

But almost as soon as he bid Emmanuel Macron adieu, his critics started questioning his political strategy — and the more than   £500 million the UK agreed to pay France to help patrol its borders.

title: Author Interview: Jenny Odell on Her New Book About Time, the Climate Crisis

title: UK Pension Funds May Vote Against Shell, BP Directors, FT Says

description: Bloomberg: Balance of Power" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show:  Former US Assistant Secretary Mark Kimmitt,  US candidate for President of the World Bank Ajay Banga  and New Jersey Attorney General Matthew Platkin. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Allbirds Shoes: Sales and Stock Fall, CFO Replaced, Store Openings Halted
description: Allbirds Inc. sold investors on a growth story when the sneaker brand went public less than 18 months ago. Those sales gains disappeared in the fourth quarter, tanking its stock.

title: Hints of Systemic Hazard Put an End to 2023 Stock Market Miracle

title: Week's Best Reads: Sydney's Rookie Traders, India's Gay Marriage Decision
description: In the ongoing fight for equality, the women of Iran are standing up against the Islamic country’s chafing dress code, while the work of a few brave souls could extend same-sex marriage rights to more than a billion people. China is pushing to end an antiquated wedding tradition in hopes of reversing a population decline, as Hong Kong debates whether Covid camps could help its housing crisis.

title: Bank Rout: It's a Curveball for Markets Anxious About the Outlook

title: GM Offers Buyouts to Accelerate $2 Billion Cost Cutting Plan

title: How Much Do Traders Earn in Australia? Some New Graduates Get $400,000
description: Graduate traders are earning salaries of as much as $400,000 straight out of school.
